meanings.definition: The act or process of moving or changing position.
meanings.sent1: The slow motion of the turtle fascinated the children at the zoo.
meanings.sent2: The car's motion down the hill was smooth and steady.
meanings.sent3: In the race, the snail's motion was comically slow compared to the other competitors.
meanings.sent4: The motion of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful motion across the stage left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: A gesture or movement of the body.
meanings.sent1: His hand motion to stop the bus was clear and visible.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast's fluid motions impressed the judges.
meanings.sent3: The robot's jerky motions made it look like it was dancing awkwardly.
meanings.sent4: Her subtle motions conveyed more than words ever could.
meanings.sent5: The mime's exaggerated motions made the audience burst into laughter.

meanings.definition: A formal proposal put forward for debate or decision.
meanings.sent1: The senator presented a motion to increase funding for schools.
meanings.sent2: The board will discuss the motion to change the company's policy.
meanings.sent3: The motion to have pizza every Friday in the cafeteria was met with cheers.
meanings.sent4: The motion to declare a snow day was unanimously approved by the students.
meanings.sent5: The motion to plant more trees in the park received overwhelming support from the community.
